network
Interface Simulator

public interface Simulator

The main control interface to the simulation. From here, nodes are created, destroyed, and manipulated at will. Use this power wisely.

Author:
Luke Maurer

Nested Class Summary
static interface Simulator.NodeBuilder
          A constructor object for Node objects.

Method Detail

buildNode

Simulator.NodeBuilder buildNode()
Begin constructing a node.

Returns:
A Simulator.NodeBuilder object to parameterize and create the new node.

buildNode

Simulator.NodeBuilder buildNode(int address)
Begin constructing a node, assigning it a specific address.

Parameters:
address - The address to assign the node.
Returns:
A Simulator.NodeBuilder object to parameterize and create the new node.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given address is already in use.

destroy

void destroy(Node node)
Shut down the given node completely and remove it from the simulation. The node should be discarded at this point.

Parameters:
node - The node to destroy.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the node is not a part of this simulation (i.e. was not created from this object's buildNode() method).

nodeAt

Node nodeAt(int address)
Retrieve the node at the given address.

Parameters:
address - The address of the node to get.
Returns:
The node at the given address.

connect

Interface connect(Node a,
                  Node b)
Connect one node to another. This actually creates a new Interface object with a new address on each node; nodes can have arbitrarily many interfaces.

Parameters:
a - One of the nodes to connect.
b - The other node.
Returns:
The new interface on a, connecting it to b.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If either a or b is not a part of this simulation.

disconnect

void disconnect(Interface iface)
Disconnect an interface, destroying it and its peer on the other node.

Parameters:
iface - The interface to disconnect.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If iface is not a part of this simulation.

createRouterKernel

Kernel createRouterKernel()
Create an instance of this simulator's default kernel for router nodes.

Returns:
A new Kernel object with routing capabilities.

createUserKernel

UserKernel createUserKernel()
Create an instance of this simulator's default kernel for hosts.

Returns:
A new UserKernel object.
See Also:
UserKernel, Process

createUserKernel

UserKernel createUserKernel(Process process)
Create an instance of this simulator's default kernel for hosts, preloaded with the given process.

Parameters:
process - The process to load into the new kernel.
Returns:
A new UserKernel object containing the given process.
See Also:
UserKernel, Process

start

void start()
Begin the simulation.

destroy

void destroy()
End the simulation, shutting down all nodes and cleaning up all resources allocated.

logger

Logger logger()
Get the logger used by the simulator for top-level messages.

Returns:
The simulator's own logger.
